page.title: 11Market Gardening
page.content: We made a visit to{Greenfield Farm}, because it was very different,from most of the other farms in the area. Instead of concentrating on Cereal crops,{Mr.Gross}showed us the types of things he grew.He said that he farmed 20 acres,of which 10,were rented from the{council. He grows in 4 fields and sells directly to the public;the things grown kept him and his 8 workers busy all year.They were: carrots,turnips,onions,runner-beans,le ttuce,beetroot,peas,sweetcorn,marrows, spinnage,cabbage,cauliflower,broccoli, and brussel sprouts. He has a hard{life-style}getting up at 6-o-clock,working until 1-00,starting again at 2.00 until 5.00.His family have worked the farm since 1927,and it has been a farm for 150 years.the vegetables we tried were lovely.
